column4: Can someone explain to me the function of RJ45 crimping dies. I have only used the simple universal radio shack tye crimpers.
Can someone explain the function of different RJ45 crimping dies? I have only used the simple universal radio shack tye crimpers.
rj-45s have to comply with a standard...what crimps one should crimp another
there are different connectors based on different wire types
also, different dies fit in different crimpers
I thought so too, but I have been looking at different crimpers that have modular dies.
but the pin spacing and whatnot is universal
i'm pretty sure what works on one will work on another
i believe mine is a 2045(older paladin) and it's worked on all rj-45's i've ever crimped
if the rj-45 fits in a NIC or switch, it will fit the crimpers
ok, also is there different tips or tipping methods for STP?
alright, I'm going to be responsible for a big network, and I was wondering if I could run some ideas by anyone who has experience.
typically, the guy in charge of the big network doesn't crimp cables...he has better things to do

Some of my ideas are, diagram everthing and maintain different levels of diagrams (physical, network, geographic). Also I am going to use twist on tags at both ends of the cable to keep track of what goes where, I will probably put the same information on both ends, switch/port user/location. Keep copies of all of my configurations. Maintain organized software repositories. Get sufficient equipment for all techs.
I will keep some sort of spread sheet or databases to keep track of everything, and maybe program some new software.
